moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3 e5 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Bb5 a6: In this game i was just hoping to give my opponent a good game, not too blunder as i so often do. Also to break up his pawn formation, plus to cause my opponent some headaches.
moves.9. Bg5 d6 10. d4 h6 11. Bh4 g5 12. Bg3 Q: I dont like this at all my King is exposed but his is stuck in the centre.
moves.18... Rd8 19. h3 Be6 20. Qd4 Rg8: A mistake from my opponent better to move the knight which is under attack from my Queen !!
moves.21. Qxf6: I sense a chance to attack his King a passage of play follows that leads to him attacking my King.
Swift counter from mrt167, can he see it home.
moves.25. Kd2 Rxd8+ 26. Nd4 Qb4+ 27. c3 Qb2+ 2: I decided to take his bishop as his rook is hanging.
moves.33... Qxb3 34. Kxd2 Qb2+ 35. Kd3: I'm not too conerned about this pawn on the a-file as i believe it wont make it !! However mine on the c-(c5) file will.
moves.35... a3 36. Ne7+ Kb7 37. c6+ Ka7 38. Qa: Nice win enjoyed this game very much.
